Imports

utils, consts, types

Types

TelegramMessageHandler = proc (event: Message): Future[void]
TelegramUpdateHandler = proc (event: Update): Future[void]
TelegramJsonHandler = proc (event: JsonNode): Future[void]
TelegramApiRef = ref object
  running*: bool               ## bot is running. Used in `pollEvents`.
  access_token: string
  client: AsyncHttpClient

Vars

tmessage_handler: TelegramMessageHandler
tupdate_handler: TelegramUpdateHandler
tjson_handler: TelegramJsonHandler

Procs

proc TelegramApi(access_token: string): TelegramApiRef {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}

Creates a new telegram API object.

Arguments:

  • access_token is a telegram bot access token
proc callMethod(self: TelegramApiRef; method_name: string; args: JsonNode = %*{}): Future[
    JsonNode] {...}{.raises: [Exception, ValueError, FutureError],
               tags: [ReadIOEffect, RootEffect, TimeEffect, WriteIOEffect].}

Calls any telegram API method.

Arguments:

  • method_name is a name of called method.
  • args - method arguments.

Iterators

iterator pollEvents(self: TelegramApiRef): JsonNode {...}{.raises: [KeyError, Defect,
    IOError, OSError, ValueError, JsonParsingError, Exception, FutureError,
    UnpackError, IndexError],
    tags: [ReadIOEffect, WriteIOEffect, RootEffect, TimeEffect].}
Real-time receiving events.

Macros

macro `~`(o: TelegramApiRef; callable: untyped): untyped

Provides convenient wrapper for callMethod.

Example:

discard await tApi~sendMessage(chat_id=123, text="hello, world!")
macro `@`(o: TelegramApiRef; field, stmtlist: untyped): untyped

provides convenitent wrapper for creating handlers.

Usage:

tApi@message(event):
  echo event.text

Templates

template listen(o: TelegramApiRef): untyped
Starts longpoll listening.
